inn1.comm: good testing start from pollock, gets the ball to jag back in and make Vincent play, the ball clips the top flap of his pad and lobs to the keeper
wide outside off, a bit of away movement, Vincent lazily throws his bat at it, wide called
slower ball outside the off stump, Vincent opens the face and glides it down to third man
left alone outside off, McCullum shuffles across the stumps and in the last second decides to let it go
strays wide outside off, wide called
better line and length, gets the ball to come into the right hander and the batsman covers the line and defends
lands it on a good length outside off, the batsman shoulders arms
good length outside off, left alone
lands it on a fullish length outside off, Vincent takes the safe option by letting it go
Appeal! Steyn catches Vincent at the crease as the ball jags back in and catches him high on the front pad
strays down the leg side and wide called
good length outside the off stump, Vincent offers the full face of the bat and pushes it past point
good length on middle and leg, gets behind the line and pushes to the on side
slightly fuller in length on middle and leg, pushed just wide of midwicket

Steyn strikes early.... poor shot by McCullum. The ball was fullish in length on middle and leg, McCullum tried to flick that past square leg but didn't watch the late outswing. He ended up playing an  inside-out stroke which caught the leading edge and lobbed high to Gibbs at extra cover
caught on the pads and a stifled appeal by Pollock
gets behind the line and defends to the off side with soft hands, they go through for a quick single
bangs it in on a good length outside off, the ball holds its line through to the keeper
similar length, only this time there is a hint of away movement as it went through to Boucher
left alone outside the off stump
beaten.. that was a jaffa from Pollock, the ball lands on a good length outside off, kicks after pitching and nearly catches the outside edge
strays on the pads and Vincent works it away to the on side
half volley just outside the off stump, in the slot to drive, Vincent pushes it off the meat of the bat to mid-off
holds the length back on off and middle, gets behind the line and defends
overpitched outside off, Vincent was a little early on the stroke but was in control of it as he drove uppishly between mid-off and cover. The placement was just right
back of a length outside off, Vincent gets his bat down on the angle and glides that past point
Steyn loses his radar completely and slides that down the leg side
left alone outside off
good length on off stump, comes in just a touch, Vincent gets a good stride forward and places it to mid-off, contemplates a single but How says no
gets forward and defends close to the pads, the ball rolls to cover

Appeal.... Vincent was struck outside the line on off stump as he got forward to defend, the ball clipped the top flap of his front pad and lobbed to point. The appeal was for the bat-pad catch but there was no bat involved as replays showed
lands it short of a length outside off, catches Vincent high on the pad again
left alone outside off
struck firmly off the front foot to the off side and AB de Villiers does brilliantly to slide to his right and save at least three runs
Steyn tests him out with a short one, How reads the length early, swivels on the back foot and pulls firmly along the ground past square leg
good length just outside the off stump, How watchfully lets it go
pitches on a good length outside off, the ball holds it line after pitching, left alone to Boucher
adjusts his line to middle and leg, gets behind the line and pushes to the on side
pitched up just outside off and swinging away, the batsman tries to drive through the line but ends playing an inside out stroke past the slips
pushed firmly past the covers for a single
bangs it short of a length outside off, Vincent steps down and scoops it over backward point. It was a pre-medidated stroke
pushed to the off side
punched firmly off the front foot to the off side and Gibbs does superbly at cover to slide to his left and cut it off
good length on middle and leg this time, gets his bat down and pushes to mid-on
fuller in length outside off, the batsman opts to gauge the bounce and let it go

that was simply stunning....the slower ball cleans him up... Steyn steams in, rolls his fingers over the ball and bowls a really slow offcutter. Vincent clearly didn't read it as the ball landed on a yorker length on middle and leg and sent the leg stump back a few yards
tests him out with a perfume ball that lands outside off and fizzes past his nose
makes him play this time, Styris pushes it to point
full and swinging away from the line of middle stump, Styris tries to work it to the on side and gets a leading edge past point
How gets a good stride forward and pushes it past point for another single
Steyn errs by drifting onto the pads, Styris shuffles and works it past square leg with a flick of the wrists. Fine leg had no chance of cutting it off
Pollock sticks to that miserly line outside the off stump, Styris shoulders arms
Pollock errs by overpitching on off and middle, How offers the full face of the bat and strokes that past mid-off. The fielder dives in despair to cut that off
How's in good touch here. Pollock offers him the luxury of width outside off stump, How offers the full face of the bat and drives off the front foot past mid-off and cover
fuller delivery outside off stump, driven wide of mid-off for a single
lands on a good length outside off, How defends very close to the pads and nearly inside edges the ball onto the stumps
slower ball, full and straight, How pushes it back to the bowler
good length outside the off stump, covers the line and pushes to the off side
maintains that length on off and middle, Styris gets on the backfoot  and defends
slightly fuller in length on off and middle, Styris turns his wrists and pushes to mid-on
Pollock's not giving anything away, cramps Styris for room again as he pushes it to the off side
same ball same result, pushed to the off side. Pollock's searching for a maiden over here
well not quite..the ball was a touch too full outside off, Styris drives and nearly beats mid-off. A sliding stop cuts off a couple more runs
bowls that on a good length outside off, slower ball, pushed to the off side
good length just outside the off stump, pushed to the off side
short, wide and spanked.... Styris reads the length early, rocks on the backfoot and slices that high over backward point. That was a poor ball which deserved to be hit
better delivery, gets the ball to cut into the right hander, Styris defends
similar delivery, Styris covers the line and defends to Nel
good length on off and middle, gets forward and pushes to the off side

Appeal... the ball slides towards the pads and straightens after pitching, How tries to flick it past midwicket but is trapped on the pads on the walk. Pollock appeals but the ball was sliding down leg anyway
short of a length on middle, pushed to mid-on
bowls that slower ball, How gets forward and defends to cover
good length outside the off stump, How gets back and defends to the covers
Pollock keeps him quiet for the fifth consecutive ball as he defends to the covers again
it's a maiden after all as How gets a good stride forward and finds the fielder at point
fullish in length outside off, Styris lunges forward and tries to steer that past point but can't beat the gap
fullish in length outside the off stump, driven to mid-off
bouncer....the ball lands on middle and leg and kicks up with the angle, Styris wasn't expecting it and rather uneasily sways out of the way
tests his out with another short one this time, however it was more in the slot for Styris to hook. He connects with control and the ball sails over short fine-leg
defended on the front foot to point
the ball angles into the pads, neatly tucked away past midwicket
fullish in length on middle and leg, pushed to the on side
good length outside the off stump, Styris covers the line and defends back to the bowler
oversteps this time....Styris shuffles across the stumps and tucks it just wide of midwicket
Styris tries to force the pace by giving himself room to whip that across the line over square leg, a wild swish only meets with thin air
full and straight, driven to mid-off
fullish outside off and in the slot to drive, Styris plays a neat stroke with the full face of the bat but can't beat mid-off
played on the front foot with soft hands to mid-off
pacy delivery outside the off stump, comes in just a touch, Styris moves his feet quickly and punches it to point
good length outside off, cuts in a little, Styris covers the line and defends back to Nel
sticks to that line and length outside off, cramping Styris for room to cut, he gets behind and defends back to the bowler

Styris was looking for that stroke and man, did he connect well.... just a hint of width outside the off stump, Styris gets his bat down on the angle, waits for the ball and plays it rather late. He slices it past backward point and even de Villiers couldn't get  a hand to it
Nel retaliates by banging it in short outside off and Styris wisely weaves away
pushed just wide of midwicket for a single
lands it on a good length on off and middle, defends back to the bowler
How closes the face of the bat and turns it to the on side
sticks to the good length on off and middle, How has no option but to play it back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler
How finally breaks the shackles and gets off strike by turning his wrists and tucking it just wide of midwicket
banged in short, Styris is quick to the task by swiveling on the backfoot and pulling it along the ground to deep square-leg.  There's protection there for that stroke
good length outside the off stump, gets forward and pushes to mid-off
beaten..... the slower ball from Nel deceives Styris as he pokes his bat forward.
another slower ball, much fuller in length this time and Styris nearly beats the off side field. Gibbs dives to his right to cut it off
good length outside off, punched off the middle of the bat but straight to cover
and again, Styris punches that firmly but can't beat the gap on the off side

and again... Styris plays it a lot squarer on the off side this time but can't beat de Villiers who throws himself to his left, swings around in the same action and hurls the ball to the striker's end and nearly catches How napping. A direct hit would have sent him packing
Styris finally finds that elusive gap on the off side.... Langeveldt gives him width outside off, Styris gets forward and drives it square past point and gully for a boundary
good length on off stump, pushed to cover
angles towards the pads, Styris turns his wrists and tucks it wide of midwicket

the slower ball claims How this time... Langeveldt bowls the off cutter, pitches just outside the line of off stump, the ball just straightens a touch after pitching and catches How in front of middle and leg as he tries to flick across the line
fullish in length, comes in with the angle, Styris works it just wide of midwicket
welcomes Taylor to the crease with a short one outside off that fizzes past him

electric fielding there,.... short and wide outside off, he cuts it firmly and it had 'four' written all over it before de Villiers threw his weight to his left and got a hand to it. The ball deflects to third man
pushed towards point
short of a length on middle and off, Styris swivels and pulls along the ground to deep square leg
pushed back to the bowler
good length slightly wide outside the off stump, opens the face and glides to third man
experiments with a short one and Taylor ducks under that bouncer down the leg side
angles towards the pads and lands it short of a length, Taylor plays it off his pads to the on side

well Langeveldt oversteps and gets the edge through to Boucher outside the off stump....he would have sent Styris packing there. The call was marginal but umpire Mark Benson wasn't convinced it was legal. We have a free hit here
Free Hit: Styris gives room and whips it to the on side. Deep square leg runs across and cuts it off
angling into the pads, tucked past square leg
pushed to the covers
Nel errs by banging that wide outside the off stump
gets forward and chips it uppishly towards mid-on, the fielder start to react as the ball lobs up but it was just wide of mid-on
short of a length outside off, pushed to the covers
thudded in short on middle and leg, Styris swivels and pulls firmly to deep square-leg
fires it on a yorker length, dug out to midwicket

played on... it wasn't a particularly good ball.... Nel gives Taylor width outside off to cut, he doesn't move his feet or cover the line and bounce and ends up getting a thick inside edge onto his stumps
invites Styris with width outside the off stump, he cuts that with force but can't beat de Villiers at point
short of a length, goes back and defends to the off side
beaten... super stuff from Langeveldt, lands it on the corridor outside the off stump, gets the ball to kick after pitching and it fizzes past the outside edge
short of a length outside off, gets the ball to curve in, punched to point
turned past midwicket for a single
greets him with a bouncer and Sinclair gets under it and ducks
flighted outside off, gets forward to the pitch of the ball and pushes to long-on
flighted on off and middle, pushed to midwicket
tossed up faster and slightly short of a length, Sinclair covers the line and defends back to Botha
adjusts to a fuller length on middle and leg, pushed wide of midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
full and straight, gets forward and defends back to Botha
good length outside the off stump, flicks across the line to the on side
gives Sinclair a bit of width outside the off stump, he opens the face and glides it to third man with an angled bat
good length on middle and off, shuffles across the stumps and shows his class by flicking that wide of midwicket with his wrists
slightly short of a length outside off, Sinclair gets into the stroke early and pulls, bisects the gap between md-on and midwicket. There wasnt enough to fetch a boundary though
pushed to point, they contemplate a single off a misfield by de Villiers
pushed to the on side
tucked just wide of midwicket for a single
tossed on middle and leg, nearly lobs it back to the bowler on the full
tossed on middle and leg, tucked away to the on side
flighted on middle and leg, steps down the track and lofts over the infield. There were cries of 'catch it' but the ball was well short of the fielder at long-on
pushes it along the ground to long-on this time
slow ball on middle and leg, just a warm-up delivery, worked towards fine leg off the pads
angled towards the pads again, Sinclair shapes to flick but the ball travels off the inside edge of the bat towards long-leg
short of a length, tucked away  to the on side

Misfield: half volley around the line of off stump, Sinclair offers the full face of the bat and drives that off the meat of the bat. Mid-off seemed to have it covered but the ball slid under his palms to the boundary
good length on middle, defended to midwicket
pushed wide of midwicket for a single
tossed on off and middle, pushed to the on side
tossed on off and middle, Styris rocks back and turns it to the on side
fullish in length on leg, turned towards fine leg
gets down and tries to sweep across the line, the ball catches him high on the pad and both bowler and keeper appeal
just a touch wide outside off, opens the face and angles it to third man
good length on off and middle, Sinclair stays back and punches it off the meat of the bat towards long-on
angles towards the pads, Styris works it to the on side with a flick of the wrists
Sinclair offers the full face of the bat and unfurls a neat backfoot punch to long-on
flighted outside off, not turn on that as he defends
fullish on middle and leg, tries to work it past midwicket but can;t beat the fielder
tossed outside off, oushed to the covers
flighted on middle and leg, pushed just wide of midwicket and that single brings up his 24th ODI fifty
turned to midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
slower ball outside off, defended to the off side
another slower ball, Sinclair glides this one to point
oh...nearly carried.... that was short, meant to be pulled, Sinclair rocks back and pulls and the ball just falls short of Gibbs at midwicket
fullish in length, driven to long-on
short of a length outside off, pushed to point
good length just outside the line of off stump, opens the face and places it wide of point for a single

Misfield.... Styris picks the length early and gets down to sweep, he connects and the ball is airborne for a while. Shaun pollock at fine leg runs across but the ball rebounds off his knee on the slide and reaches the boundary
pushed back to the bowler
pushed just wide of point
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
Pollock is cutting the pace of the ball here, the batsman opens the face of the bat on the off side and glides that to third man
adjusts to a shorter length outside off, the ball suddenly kicks and catches Sinclair and Boucher by surprise
gets forward, covers the line and punches that just wide of cover for a single
short of a length on middle and leg, turned just wide of square leg
played with soft hands to the covers, they set off and complete a quick single
flighted on middle and leg, swept to fine leg
flighted on middle and leg, Styris steps down the track and chips it safely over the infield. Long-on runs forward to pick that up
gets forward and drives to long-off

superb commitment from Nel.... Styris steps down and tries to launch Botha downtown over long-on, he fails to get to the pitch of the ball, doesnt get the desired elevation and Nel from deep midwicket runs across, takes it running backwards, catching it on the fall. There was a bit of confusion with two fielders converging but Nel wanted it
defended back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, glided to third man
good length outside the off stump and left alone
just a hint of width outside the off stump, Oram covers the line and punches it pas t covers
gets forward to defend well away from the body, he manages to keep it down though

Dropped: good length outside off, the ball suddenly kicks after pitching and Sinclair gets a thick outside edge. The ball bisects the gap between keeper and Smith at first slip. Both dive and Smith sort of gets a hand to it and fumbles
played back to the bowler
Nel runs in from round the wicket, glided past backward point for a single
pushed to the off side for a single
the bouncer... Nel fires this one outside off, Oram weaves out of the way and the ball just fizzes past his face
good length outside off, played with soft hands just wide of cover and they complete a quick single
tucked away towards midwicket
steams in and bangs it in on a good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
Steyn loses his radar and slides that well wide outside the off stump
gets the ball to move away from the left hander with the angle, Oram sticks his bat out and glides it to third man
slides towards the pads, Sinclair tries to work it to the on side but was too early on the stroke, the ball rolls to the on side
slower ball on off and middle, Oram pushes it wide of cover
good length outside the off stump, steered wide of cover
good length outside off, steered straight to point
short of a length, Sinclair pulls but the ball connects off the toe edge of the bat and rolls wide of midwicket
fires that on the blockhole,Oram manages to dig it out
pushed towards the off side

adjusts to a fuller length on middle and leg, Oram flicks his wrists and beats the infield on the on side. The ball heads to the deep midwicket boundary but Duminy does well to run across from deep square leg to cut that off
full on middle and leg, Sinclair tries to force that wide of mid-on but finds the fielder
fullish outside off and pushed to long-on
starts the new over with a bouncer, Sinclair just ducks under it
full and punched back firmly to Steyn, he picks up the ball and throws it back at the stumps and misses
short of a length, Sinclair goes for a pull but the ball suddenly hurries on him, still he manages to keep the ball along the ground
drifts wide outside off and Oram lets it go
streaky... that was short and wide outside off, Oram pulls without moving his feet, the ball gets the underedge of the bat, beats the keeper and goes to fine leg
short of a length on middle and leg, Oram swivels and connects cleanly this time. The ball races off the meat of the bat and beats deep square leg as it reaches the deep midwicket boundary
yorker length, Oram tries to glance it past the keeper but the ball clips his pads and rolls past the keeper
full outside off, driven to long-on
Appeal...Sinclair gets down to sweep, the ball strikes him on the pads outside the line of the stumps
tossed on middle and leg, turned to the on side
tossed outside off and pushed to long-on
flighted outside off and pushed to the covers
aims for the yorker length, turns into a low full toss and Sinclair drives that to long-off
short and slightly wide outside off, Oram shapes to slap that past point but ends up chopping it down on the pitch off the toe edge of the bat
overpitched on off and middle, Oram scoops it over the bowler's head but there wasn't enough timing to meet the boundary
full and wide outside off, Oram gives room to smash that past extra cover but misses it completely
fullish outside off and pushed to mid-off
flighted on middle and leg, takes a few paces forward and pushes that to midwicket
flighted outside off, Oram takes a couple of paces forward, sweeps uppishly and finishes the stroke off one arm. There was enough timing and power to find the deep square leg boundary
defended back to Botha
pushed just wide of point
steps down the track, Botha fires that outside off and Sinclair angles it on the full past point
just a touch too full on the pads and Sinclair whips it towards long leg
gives him a bit of width outside off, Oram tries to sqeeze it past cover but can;t find the gap
holds the length back a little, Oram goes for the pull but can't get any elevation. He ends up slamming it to mid-on
turned to the on side, they go through for a quick single and Oram just manages to scamper back
pushed to the off side, they take a chance with de Villiers and go through for a run, the throw was just a little wide and this time Sinclair was in trouble
pushed to the off side for a single
goes for the reverse sweep, the ball lobs up and just falls short of Langeveldt at short third-man
and finally.... Botha gives it plenty of air, Oram steps down and launches a high full-toss over long-on and that brings up the fifty partnership as well
pushed to long-on
flighted on off and middle, pushed to long-off
takes a coupls of paces down, meets the ball on the full and pushes to long-on
Appeal... good length on the off stump, Sinclair shuffles across and covers his stumps, he tries to flick across the line but the ball catches him high on the pads and rolls to the off side

soft dismissal.... Langeveldt bangs it in short of a length, Oram backs away and tries to biff that over deep square leg, he was never in control of the stroke and ended up playing far too early. The top edge lobs up for a long time and lands down Smith's throat at midwicket
overthrows...glided towards point, de Villiers picks up and throws at the striker's end, Mills was short of his ground but there was nobody to back the throw, allowing an extra run
pushed firmly back to the bowler who does well to get a hand to it
fullish outside the off stump and pushed to extra cover
short of a length, drifts towards the batsman's body, he hops and glances to fine leg
good length outside the off stump, keeps it down to point
beaten... pitches on a good length outside off, Mills tries to glide that to third man but there wasn't too much width for him to work with

played with soft hands behind the wicket, Mills sets off, Boucher gathers the ball and flings it to the non-striker's end. The ball strikes the stumps but Mills was home. The third umpire was called in to adjudicate
searches for the yorker but ends up bowling it too full on the pads. Sinclair works it with ease off his pads and beats short fine-leg
full, on the pads, turned to deep square-leg
better delivery, gets the yorker on target and the batsman does well to dig it out
yorker length outside the off stump, pushed to the deep on the off side
chipped uppishly towards the vacant midwicket region and Sinclair reaches his 10th ODI fifty
steps down the track and pulls to mid-off
good shot... Langeveldt was punished for bowling length at this stage, Sinclair waits on it, pulls over midwicket and finds the gap on the deep
Langeveldt overcompensates by bowling this too full, drifts on the pads and Sinclair turns it with his wrists past short fine-leg
backs away and smashes it to backward point
Nel errs by bowling this too full... Mills takes a few paces forward, meets the full toss off the meat of the bat and lofts through the line over the extra cover and long-off boundary
pushed to the off side for a single
Nel gets the treatment by bowling it too full again, this time Sinclair meets the pitch of the ball and lofts over extra cover
on the blockhole outside the off stump, Sinclair squeezes this one to third man
the over gets better and better for New Zealand.... this was wide outside the off stump, the batsman scoops it on the full over backward point and finds the vacant area on the off side
swing and a miss, Mills loses his concentration there
fires that on a yorker length outside off, Sinclair digs it out side of cover, Kallis fumbles and they go through for three

Mills slips.... Mills plays it back towards the bowler and attempts a run which wasn't there. Mills runs, then is sent back, slips and falls backwards on the turn. By this time Langeveldt had already gathered the ball and underarmed it to the stumps. Embarassing for Mills
good length outside off, pushed to long-on
full toss outside off and pushed to long-on
backs away from the stumps, tries to slash that past short third-man but finds the fielder there
innovation from Vettori and it works.... Steyn aims for the yorker on the off stump, Vettori moves across the stumps, meets it on the full and turns it wide of short fine-leg
the slower ball and well executed in the end as Vettori failed to pick it. He swings across the line and misses
Vettori moves across his stumps again to unsettle the bowler and Steyn wins this battle as well as Vettori fails to make contact

another embarassing run-out.... Steyn bowls a low full toss, Vettori fails to push it past the bowler Sinclair goes for the run anyway and sacrifices his wicket. Steyn walks to the non striker's end and removes the bails

Vettori finishes off the innings with a boundary...he gives himself room, flat-bats a fullish delivery past the bowler with force. The fielders patrolling long-on and long-off had no chance, thanks to the placement

inn2.comm: an appeal straightaway.... pitches short of a length in line with middle stump, gets the ball to angle in and strikes Smith high on the pads. Too high, we reckon
strays a little wide outside the off stump, punched to the off side
Mills gives him width outside the off stump again, Smith tries to sliced it past point but doesn't succeed
and again, Smith has another opportunity to cut square but finds point again
beaten...this is good stuff from Mills, lands it just short of a driveable length outside off, teases Smith on the drive
strays on the pads and Smith eases the nerves as he tucks it away with ease past square leg
fullish in length outside the off stump, in the slot to drive, Gibbs closes the face as the ball meets the bat and as a result, can't beat mid-off
full in length again, on the stumps and Gibbs pushes it softly back to the bowler
that's a gift.... Gillespie errs by angling this one on the pads, Gibbs nonchalantly turns his wrists and flicks past square leg. The timing was perfect

Appeal..and this was quite close. Gibbs defends really close to the pads. Gillespie and the rest appeal thinking the ball would have struck middle stump. Perhaps the umpire imagined there was bat involved
Gillespie strays towards the pads again and pays the price as Gibbs turns his wrists and works it away past midwicket
fullish in length outside off and pushed to point
beaten.... Mills lands it on the corridor outside the off stump, Smith has to have a poke at it and well...nearly gets an outside edge
left alone outside the off stump, good bounce and carry for Mills
action replay...Smith lets it go and the ball angles in towards the left hander after pitching
tucked away off the pads, the ball speeds away  towards the deep midwicket boundary and a committed dive by Vincent, running backwards, saves a boundary
on the pads and that's easy for Gibbs who works it away down towards fine leg
good length outside the off stump, left alone
full in length wide outside the off stump, Smith misses an opportunity for a boundary by mistiming it to mid-off
on the pads and worked just wide of mid-on
Gillespie oversteps.... not only that, he bangs it in wide of off stump, allowing Gibbs enough time to swat that over backward point. We have a free hit here
Free Hit: Gibbs fails to capitalise on it. Low full toss by Gillespie, Gibbs backs away and swats it to mid-on
this time Gibbs suceeds... half volley on middle and leg, Gibbs gets his bat down, offers the full face of the bat and caresses it past the bowler, beats mid-on as well
defended back to the bowler
Gibbs drives away from the body and nearly chops it onto the stumps
good length on the off stump, Smith chops it back to Mills
just a little too wide outside the off stump, Smith waits on it and glides it past point with an open face of the bat
good length outside off, pushed to point

shot of the match so far.... good length delivery from Mills, Gibbs takes a few paces down the track, meets the pitch of the ball, closes the face and lofts staright back over the bowler's head. That was dead straight
full in length outside off, pushed to mid-off
full in length outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single

welcome to the crease Mr Oram... digs it in short of a length on middle, Gibbs again takes a few paces down, closes the face of the bat, pulls across the line and the ball just lands over the deep midwicket rope
swing and a miss outside the off stump
that was close... Gibbs lets it go outside off, the ball nips back off the seam and was quite close to the off stump
good length outside off, goes for the expansive drive but mistimes it to mid-off
outside off and placed to point
take that..after a series of dot balls, Gibbs launches into one outside off. He gets a half stride forward, meets the ball off the middle of the bat and beats cover
defended off the back foot
beaten... Smith is still uncertain of his offstump. The ball lands on the corridor outside off, holds its line and Smith could have shouldered arms to that one instead of poking his bat out
fuller in length outside off, gets a thick outside edge to third man
shuffles and works it past square leg for a single
fullish in length outside off, angles away from the left-hander, pushed wide of cover for a single
bangs it in short of a length and catches Gibbs on the hop as he uneasily defends the ball
gets the ball to cut in after pitching, cramps Smith for room but he defends off the full face of the bat
Oram makes it easy for Smith by straying on the pads, he works it to the deep on the on side. Deep square leg cuts it off

now this IS the shot of the match so far..... good length on off and middle, Gibbs treats Oram like a spinner by getting on his knees and sweeping his over deep backward square-leg. The bat speed on that was tremendous. No wonder, as the ball travelled quite a few rows back
left alone outside the off stump
strays wide outside off and Gibbs works it off an angled bat to third man
turned off the pads to deep square leg. There's a misfield but the pair settle for a single
turned to the on side
whoops...the first false stroke from Gibbs. He swings at one wide outside off, doesn't meet the pitch of the ball, the keeper fails to gather it and the ball rolls behind the wicket for 2 byes
thinks about cutting the ball square on the off side but lets it go
short of a length on off and middle, pulled along the ground to the on side
good length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
the offcutter, pitches outside off, Gibbs glides that to gully
full on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
that was slow, very slow and Smith wasn't interested in bashing that. He just defends on the front foot
good length on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
pushed wide of cover for a single
slower ball again, Gibbs works it to the off side
lands it short of a good length outside off, no turn, Smith punches it just wide of mid-on
floats it on the leg stump, Gibbs tries to work it through the line but the ball strikes him on the pad
tossed on middle and leg, pushed through the line to long-on
tucked off the backfoot to the on side
full and wide outside off, Gibbs gets a big stride forward and smashes that past extra cover. He also brings up his fifty with that stroke
tossed on middle and leg, turned with the wrists to fine leg
tucked towards midwicket, a sliding stop cuts off a couple of runs
fullish in length on middle and leg, pushed with the line of the ball to long-on
the offcutter again, Smith gets forward, plays with soft hands just wide of cover and sets off. Good judgement there from the pair
works it to midwicket but turns down the single
slides down leg and wide called
fullish outside off, gets forward and angles the ball to point
on the stumps, worked across the line to midwicket
sweeps from outside the off stump, fails to connect
good length outside off, works it with the turn past forward short-leg
pushed in flatter and faster, Gibbs stays back and tucks it wide of midwicket
flighted outside off, Smith shuffles and tucks it wide of square leg
flighted outside off, driven past the infield on the off side and Patel at sweeper cover cuts it off
flighted outside off, glided to short third-man off an open face
full on middle and off, Gibbs gets a big stride forward and forces it to midwicket
gifts him with width outside off and Gibbs obliges by square driving past point. He bisected the gap so perfectly that there was no fielder in sight
turned to midwicket
full, on the pads and pushed to midwicket
full outside off and pushed to cover
good length outside off and punched back to the bowler
No turn at all, that just went straight through to McCullum outside off
flighted on middle and leg, paddle-swept to long leg
tossedup outside off, Gibbs stays rooted to the crease, gets on his knee and lofts over extra cover. McCullum yells out for a catch but Gibbs was well in control of the stroke
slam, bang.... flighted on middle and leg, Gibbs, as if expecting it, gets on his knee and slog sweeps that over cow corner. That was pasta and salad for Gibbs as he made it look so easy
turned to midwicket
gets on his knee and sweeps to fine leg. That's 13 off the over
good length on middle and leg, tucked to long leg
short of a length outsode off, comes in with the angle, pushed back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler
beaten..lapse in concentration from Smith as the ball beat the outside edge outside the off stump. McCullum fumbles with the ball as well
fullish outside off and pushed to long-off
tucked away off the pads to short fine-leg
tossed up outside off and pushed back to the bowler
flighted on middle and leg, worked towards long-leg
tossed on middle and leg, worked against the spin to the on side
worked to the on side and that brings up the 100-run stand. All too easy for South Africa here
flighted outside off and punched back to Patel
gives it more air, defends on the front foot close to the pad, McCullum gets excited but the bowler wasn't interested in appealing
the offcutter, Gibbs goes for another across-the-line slog and misses, the ball deflects off his elbow to the off side
tucked to the on side, Gibbs pushes for a couple and makes his ground
outside off, tries to glide it to third man but misses
pushed to the covers
pushed to mid-off
good length on the pads, shuffles across his stumps and works it to fine leg
tossed up on off and middle, Gibbs steps down, gets to the pitch of the ball and smothers the spin, lofts against the turn over extra cover
pushed to the off side
short of a length, Gibbs rocks on the backfoot, the bounce was just right for Gibbs to biff that over cow corner with intent
outside off and worked towards third man for a single
Smith sweeps without getting to the pitch of the ball, gets a top edge but the ball falls safely behind the keeper and first slip
fullish on leg stump, pushed to long-on
good length on middle and off, Gibbs gets his front foot forward and swings over square leg, the ball falls short of deep backward square-leg
pushed to the off side for a single
outside off, Gibbs opens the face of the bat and glides it wide of point
edged and dropped.... Smith slashes at one outside off, gets a thin outside edge and McCullum fails to get his gloves behind the ball
take that! the slow off cutter on off and middle, Gibbs picks his spot, meets the pitch of the ball and lofts that high over deep midwicket. Tha ball lands on the roof of the first tier
comes round the wicket, pitches outside off, Smith covers the line and works it to gully
tries to flick across the line but the ball clips the top flap of the pad and rolls to the keeper
Smith brings up his first boundary..finally..in the 21st over... that was full and wide outside off, Smith gets behind the line and caresses it through the covers
tucked away to the off side for a single
and he brings it up in style.... short and wide outside off, Gibbs hops at the crease and flat-bats that over mid-off and extra cover to bring up a ton in just 77 balls
outside off and Gibbs fishes at the ball. Lucky not to get an edge there
Smith joins the fun by gliding a short of a length delivery outside off past short third man. He picked his spot and waited for the ball to come to him
gets a bit of width again outside off, Smith gives room, gets his bat down on the angle and beats short third-man and gully
flighted outside off and pushed back to the bowler
punched back to Vettori on the backfoot
flighted on middle and leg, turned to deep square-leg
fires it on a good length on off stump, Smith covers the line and defends off the full face of the bat
Smith gains in confidence here.... full on off stump, Smith backs away before the ball lands, meets the pitch of the ball and scoops it over the bowler and mid-off
fullish on off and driven to the covers
the ball angles in towards the pads and Smith tucks it off his hips towards long leg for a couple
Gillespie doesn't alter his line or length, Smith again clips it with ease off the pads to fine leg
bangs it in short, Gibbs withdraws his stroke as the ball fizzes over his head. The umpire calls it a no ball for height

Gibbs' imperious form continues.... that wasnt a bad ball at all, on a good length on off stump, he picks the length early, uses his bottom hand and flat bats that over long-on while staying rooted to the crease
Dropped: Smith charges down the track trying to clear mid-on, Sinclair throws himself to his left, gets a hand to it but the ball just slips out of his palm
tucked away to the on side for a single
full and wide outside off, Smith punishes that past mid-off, the ball shoots away towards the boundary but Sinclair does well to cut it off
glided to short third-man
gets a big stride forward, smothers the spin and defends
full and slightly wide outside off, pushed to mid-off
Smith charges down and misses as he tries to hoick that over the on side
teases Smith outside the off stump, Smith tries to glide that down to third man but misses
short of a length and pulled to square leg
short of a length outside off, Gibbs waits on it and slaps it over extra cover, the ball lands in the middle of nowhere
tries to work it past the infield close to short third-man
Smith brings up his fifty with a nudge to the on side. A hardworking fifty from the captain
tries to work it away towards midwicket but gets caught on the [ad
flighted on off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, worked off the pads to the on side
on the pads and turned towards fine leg for a couple
what was that?! Gibbs gets cheeky by working a full ball from outside off to the on side, he gets a leading edge which falls well in front of cover
good length on middle and off, turned to midwicket
fullish and wide outside the off stump, Gibbs square-drives it to Patel at sweeper cover
full outside off and forced through the off side
good length around the off stump, forced towards point

Smith chances his arm by lofting with the turn, Vettori holds the length back on middle and leg, Smith charges down and lofts but fails to get the desired elevation. Gillespie at deep midwicket takes it easily
Gibbs works it to midwicket for a single
Kallis shows the full face of the bat and defends
pushed in faster, defended back to the bowler
good length outside off, cramps Gibbs for room as he pushes it back to Mills
fuller in length, Gibbs gives room and takes a couple of paces forward, he meets the ball on the full but can't beat cover
worked away off the hips past midwicket
good length bang on middle stump, Kallis turns his backfoot and glances it wide of square leg
good length outside the off stump, driven to deep cover
good length outside the off stump, defended to mid-off
flighted on middle and leg, Gibbs charges down and lofts over the infield on the on side and the ball lands well in front of long on
Kallis goies for an uppish drive past the covers but is beaten
on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
pushed in faster, played to the covers
good length outside the off stump, pushed wide of cover
pushed in flat and wide outside off, Kallis rocks back and cuts it fiercely square of the wicket on the off side
flighted on off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
Kallis walks across his stumps and nudges it to the deep on the on side
short of a length on middle, pulled with force to deep square leg
pushed in faster, defended to the covers
flighted outside off and worked to long-on with the turn
flighted outside off, defended to point
tossed on middle and leg, turned to the on side
tossed up slowly outside off, defended on the front foot

sudden rush of blood for Gibbs... flighted outside off, he slog sweeps against the turn, gets a top edge, the timing wasn't enough to get the desired elevation and Kyle Mills at long leg takes it easily
pushed in flatter and faster, de Villiers defends
defended on the front foot back to the bowler
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
defended back to the bowler
flighted outside off, de Villiers tries to work it past midwicket
pushed in on a fuller length on middle, turned to midwicket
left alone outside off though the ball wasn't too far from that off stump
forced off the backfoot to long-on
flighted outside off, gets a bit of turn, de Villiers slices it to point
pushed in fuller outside off, driven to point
gives it a lot more air this time, defended to the covers
pushed in flatter and slightly wide outside off, Kallis cuts to sweeper cover
pushed back to the bowler
flighted outside off, pushed off the front foot to cover

soft dismissal.... overpitched outside off, de Villiers gets forward and scoops that rather tamely to Sinclair at short cover. It wasn't particularly a wicket-taking ball but de Villiers only had himself to blame for that lapse

the arm ball from Vettori, draws Duminy forward, he fails to cover the line and ends up getting a thin outside edge through to McCullum who went up in a flash. It didn't take long for the umpire to give that out as well.
banged in short of a length outside off, Kallis rocks back and crashes the ball through the packed off side field. Vettori runs across from cover and tries his best to pull it back
full and just a touch wide outside off, driven firmly to cover
Kallis drives just wide of cover and eases the nerves as South Africa edge closer
fires that on a goo length outside off with intent, Boucher defends of the front foot
tries to force the ball through the on side but closes the face of the bat. The ball rolls to the on side
fullish on middle and leg, Boucher tries to tuck it off his pads past midwicket but can't find the gap again
good length on off and middle, defended back to Gillespie
and a maiden it is as Gillespie gets behind the line and blocks it back to Gillespie

nearly had him there.... kallis blocks it down to the off side and sets off for a quick single. McCullum runs forward, picks up the ball and flings it at the non-strikers end. A direct hit would have had had Kallis walking back to pavilion
glanced just wide of point and gully and South Africa run hard for that couple
pushed back to the bowler
Styris errs by bowling that too short, Boucher has enough time to rock back, pull over square leg. This is the Powerplay and there's no protection there
he bowls this one too full and towards the pads, Boucher galnces it softly with his wrists and beats short fine-leg
good length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length on middle and leg, tucked wide of midwicket
edged and South Africa will take it.... no slip in place and Boucher pokes his bat out and gets a thick outside edge which sails past McCullum
good length on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
Gillespie errs by straying on the pads, Boucher turns the ball with his wrists and beats short fine-leg
banged in short, Kallis ducks and lets it go
flighted on middle and leg, gets forward and pushes it firmly to deep midwicket
flighted on middle and leg again, turned to deep square leg
flighted on middle, another easy tuck to the on side
tossed up outside off, Kallis gets forward and defends
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to the on side
fired in short of a length outside off, Kallis gets behind the line and defends to gully
that was class.... good length delivery around the off stump, Kallis plays with the 'V" and drives that crisply past the bowler and mid-on who didn;t bother to slide and stop that
Kallis follows it up with another crisp drive, this time through the covers. The ball  was too full and wide and nobody in the packed off side field could get near it
good length on off stump, pushed to the covers
fullish on middle stump, driven to mid-on
fullish outside off and Kallis plays a text-book cover drive, though straight to the fielder
flighted on middle and leg, tucked away firmly past midwicket, a committed save at the boundary saves a couple of runs
pushed in flatter and faster outside off, Boucher rocks back, slices past point and gully and picks up three
left alone outside off, the ball wasn't too far from the off stump
glided towards point
Kallis glides this one to short third man and Boucher refuses the single
pushed just wide of cover, they scamper through for a single
well, well.... it doesn't come easier than that... short and wide outside off, Kallis stretches out to cut, gets a thin outside edge to McCullum
fullish outside off, pushed to mid-off
fullish outside off, pushed to mid-off
well this is amusing! Vincent gives Pollock an offering by banging one in short at his gentle pace, Pollock just checks his stroke and blocks, Vincent sees the funny side to it
pushed to mid-off, another dot
flighted on middle, Boucher gets forward, smothers the spin and turns it past square leg, scores level now
flighted on middle and leg, Pollock steps down, meets the ball on the full and scoops it over midwicket
